metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3277 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An uncontrolled resource consumption flaw was found in openstack-neutron. This flaw allows a remote authenticated user to query a list of security groups for an invalid project. This issue creates resources that are unconstrained by the user's quota. If a malicious user were to submit a significant number of requests, this could lead to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3277` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-dhcp-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-l3-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-linuxbridge-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-macvtap-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-metadata-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-metering-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-openvswitch-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-plugin-linuxbridge-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-plugin-sriov-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-server - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
neutron-sriov-agent - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
python-neutron - 2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This issue was fixed in (2:20.3.0-0ubuntu1) in jammy-proposed, and was later released to -security.

criterions.comment: neutron package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:12.1.1-0ubuntu8.1').
